column4: Vista lets me use my camera as either a camera or a USB mass storage device.  Why can't Ubuntu do the same?  It only detects it as a camera (not USB), plus now F-Spot and gthumb won't work.  For once, Vista beats Ubuntu.

you comparission is not really fair you know? your Vista drivers for you cameras are made by the maker of the cam... they are complete... you ubuntu drivers for you cam is made up by users guessing how to make it work...
